newsitem.title: PANAMA: Panama to join World Trade Organization in 30 days.
newsitem.headline: Panama to join World Trade Organization in 30 days.

text.p: Panama's President Ernesto Perez Balladares has signed the law which will see the Central American country join the World Trade Organization (WTO), a government spokesman said Wednesday.
"The president ratified yesterday evening Panama's entry into the WTO, and within 30 days we will become a member of the WTO," a government spokesman told Reuters.

The ratification of the law, earlier passed by parliament, will formally be presented to the Geneva-based WTO for its membership to become effective one month later, a statement from the presidency said.
"Entry into the WTO will place Panama in the global economy, which will permit it to modernize its trade with the exterior and to capture foreign investment," the statement added.
Panama is the last country in Latin America to seek WTO membership, which already has over 120 member countries.
(( -- Paul de Bendern, Panama City newsroom, 507-223 7739))
